p: The plant used in this study is the spontaneous sage Salvia officinalis ( Figure 6). In our study, 30-cm apical branches were collected from Chrea, a mountainous area named Tell Atlas, near Blida, Northern Algeria (Latitude: 36°25′32′′ N, Longitude: 2°52′36′′ E, Altitude 946m), just before the appearance of the first floral bud in March 2016.This geographical location offers the plant a typically Mediterranean climate.
